page.title: 19CARR WOOD
page.content: Carr Wood is a deciduous wood between Jackson Bridge and Hepworth. A stream runs through it as does a public footpath. Cattle graze throughout the wood and poultry are kept in the Northern end. The most common trees are the Sycamore and the Beech with many Ash and Oak and several Silver Birch and Elder. Holly, Hawthorn and Wild Rose are common bushes, with areas of Gorse, Bramble and Bilberry. July flowers include Red and White clover, Buttercup, Thistle, Purple and White Foxglove, White Dead Nettle, Honeysuckle, Daisy, Tufted Vetch, Creeping Cinquefoil and White Goosegrass. Grey Squirrels, Hedgehogs and Rabbits live in the wood and there are fishes in the stream. Other wildlife includes Foxes, Stoats, Weasels and occasional sightings of Badgers(for bird life-page 15).
